definitions.definition: The ability or condition of shining with reflected light ; sheen , gleam , gloss , sparkle , shine , etc.

subdefinitions.definition: ( geology ) The way in which the surface of any particular type of mineral reflects light differently from other minerals, which is helpful in telling minerals apart.

definitions.definition: ( figurative ) Shining light from within, luminosity , brightness , shine .
examples: the luster of the minor stars

definitions.definition: ( figurative ) Shining beauty , splendor , attractiveness or attraction .
examples: After so many years in the same field, the job had lost its luster .
After the scandal, the idol lost his luster and could only get work in Vegas .
Sure, the posh git spoke with fine lustre . ’S all a load of bollocks, though, innit?

subdefinitions.definition: ( literary ) Any shining body or thing .
A piece of glass added to a light ( especially a chandelier ) to increase its luster.
An ornamental light providing luster, especially a chandelier .
A substance that imparts luster to a surface , such as polish , gloss , plumbago , glaze , etc.
The layer of an object that imparts luster, chiefly with regard to ceramics .
Clipping of lusterware : highly lustrous ceramics .
A kind of lustrous fabric with a wool weft and cotton , linen , or silk warp , chiefly used for women 's dresses .
( obsolete ) A glory , an act or thing that imparts fame or renown .

main_definition: The ability or condition of shining with reflected light ; sheen , gleam , gloss , sparkle , shine , etc.
secondary_definitions: ( figurative ) Shining light from within, luminosity , brightness , shine .
( figurative ) Shining beauty , splendor , attractiveness or attraction .

definitions.definition: Alternative form of lustrum : A five - year period , especially ( historical ) in Roman contexts .

main_definition: Alternative form of lustrum : A five - year period , especially ( historical ) in Roman contexts .

definitions.definition: ( now rare ) One who lusts , one inflamed with lust .

main_definition: ( now rare ) One who lusts , one inflamed with lust .

definitions.definition: Synonym of den : a dwelling - place in a wilderness , especially for animals .

main_definition: ( obsolete ) Synonym of den : a dwelling - place in a wilderness , especially for animals .
